Text saved: A gene is a small part of your body. It tells your body how to grow and work. We have more questions about genes. We want to know how they affect our brain and our language. Did some genes change and give us the power to speak? Scientists found a gene that changed a long time ago. This happened between 100,000 and 200,000 years ago. This gene seems important for speaking. It helps our brains move our mouths and face. Monkeys have a very similar gene, but their gene did not change. We do not know now how important genes are for language. But one day we might find the answers in our DNA.
